skill.name: matlab
skill.description: MATLAB and GNU Octave numerical computing for matrix operations, data analysis, visualization, and scientific computing. Use when writing MATLAB/Octave scripts for linear algebra, signal processing, image processing, differential equations, optimization, statistics, or creating scientific visualizations. Also use when the user needs help with MATLAB syntax, functions, or wants to convert between MATLAB and Python code. Scripts can be executed with MATLAB or the open-source GNU Octave interpreter.
skill.summary: MATLAB and GNU Octave numerical computing for matrix operations, data analysis, visualization, and s...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI
skill.license: For MATLAB (https://www.mathworks.com/pricing-licensing.html) and for Octave (GNU General Public License version 3)

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing markdown reference files for MATLAB/Octave scientific computing. All 627 static findings are false positives caused by the analyzer misidentifying markdown code block syntax as Ruby/shell backticks, and educational algorithm references as weak cryptography. No executable code, credential handling, data exfiltration, or network operations exist.

content.user_title: Write MATLAB and Octave scientific computing scripts
content.value_statement: Need to perform matrix operations, data analysis, or scientific visualization? This skill provides comprehensive MATLAB and GNU Octave references for linear algebra, signal processing, image processing, differential equations, optimization, and statistics with ready-to-use code examples.
actual_capabilities: Generate MATLAB and Octave scripts for matrix operations and linear algebra
Create visualizations including 2D plots, 3D surfaces, and data charts
Implement data import/export for CSV, Excel, MAT files, and images
Build statistical analysis pipelines with regression and grouping
Solve differential equations using ODE solvers like ode45
Integrate with Python using MATLAB py interface
limitations: Requires MATLAB or GNU Octave installed to execute generated scripts
Does not provide access to proprietary MATLAB toolboxes without license
Cannot run scripts directly - generates code for user execution

use_cases.title: Data analysis pipelines
use_cases.description: Load CSV data, perform statistical analysis with grouping and regression, then visualize results with publication-ready charts.

use_cases.title: Signal processing
use_cases.description: Apply FFT, filtering, and convolution to process signals and extract frequency components from sensor data.

use_cases.title: Numerical simulation
use_cases.description: Solve differential equations for physical systems, implement numerical methods, and visualize simulation results.

prompt_templates.title: Matrix operations
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create a 3x3 identity matrix, perform matrix multiplication, and solve a linear system Ax=b in MATLAB.

prompt_templates.title: Data visualization
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 2D plot with sine and cosine waves, add labels, legend, and grid, then save the figure as PNG.

prompt_templates.title: File processing
prompt_templates.prompt: Read a CSV file with mixed data types, handle missing values, and export results to a new CSV file.

prompt_templates.title: ODE solving
prompt_templates.prompt: Solve the differential equation dy/dt = -2y with y(0)=1 using ode45 and plot the solution over t=[0,5].

output_examples.input: Create a MATLAB script that reads experiment data, calculates mean and standard deviation by group, and saves a bar chart.

best_practices: Preallocate arrays before loops to improve performance in MATLAB scripts.
Use vectorized operations instead of element-by-element loops for faster execution.
Choose readtable for mixed data types and readmatrix for pure numeric data.
anti_patterns: Avoid growing arrays inside loops - preallocate with zeros or ones instead.
Do not use single quotes for strings in Octave if compatibility with MATLAB is needed.
Avoid hardcoding file paths - use fullfile() for cross-platform path handling.

faq.question: Does this skill require MATLAB installation?
faq.answer: MATLAB or GNU Octave must be installed to run generated scripts. Octave is free and open-source.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for both MATLAB and Octave?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill includes Octave compatibility references for code that works in both environments.

faq.question: How do I save figures in MATLAB?
faq.answer: Use saveas(gcf, 'filename.png') for quick saves or print('-dpdf', 'filename.pdf') for vector graphics.

faq.question: What data formats can I import?
faq.answer: MATLAB supports CSV, Excel, MAT files, images, text files, and more through built-in functions.

faq.question: Can I call Python from MATLAB?
faq.answer: Yes. Use py.importlib.import_module() to import Python modules and call functions with py.module.function().

faq.question: How do I handle missing data?
faq.answer: Use rmmissing(T) to remove rows with NaN values or fillmissing() to interpolate missing values.
